page.description: Alpha Anywhere pages have access to a system object named Response.
page.discussion: Alpha Anywhere pages have access to a system object named Response. This object represents the HTTP response that will be created by the Application Server and sent back to the client. It has a number properties and methods available. The server creates this object for each client Response and can be accessed directly by your applications.

property.name: Response.Charset
property.description: Specifies the Charset header for the outgoing response.

property.name: Response.Mime_Type
property.description: Specifies the Content-Type header for the outgoing response.

property.name: Response.Reason_Phrase
property.description: Specifies the HTTP Reason Phrase for the outgoing response.

property.name: Response.Status_Code
property.description: Specifies the HTTP Status Code for the outgoing response.

method.name: Response.AddCookie Method?
method.description: Sets a cookie to be sent back to the client as part of the response.

method.name: Response.Add_Cookie Method
method.description: Sets a cookie to be sent back to the client as part of the response.
method.note: This method is deprecated. It is included in V10 for backwards compatibility only and it will be removed in a future version. Response.AddCookie Method? is the replacement method which should be used.

method.name: Response.AddHeader Method?
method.description: Sets a header to be sent back to the client as part of the response.

method.name: Response.Add_Header Method
method.description: Sets a header to be sent back to the client as part of the response.
method.note: This method is deprecated. It is included in V10 for backwards compatibility only and it will be removed in a future version. Response.AddHeader Method? is the replacement method which should be used.

method.name: Response.Expire Method?
method.description: Sets a header to indicate when the client should expire this response from its cache.

method.name: Response.NoCache Method?
method.description: Sets headers to indicate that the client should not store this response in its cache at all.

method.name: Response.Redirect Method
method.description: Redirects the client to a new URL.

method.name: Response.SendFile Method?
method.description: Sends the specified file to the client as the response body, setting headers as appropriate.
